member.name: T:Blazorade.Teams.Components.TeamsApplication
member.summary: The root component for all application pages in your Microsoft Teams tab application.

remarks.para: This component inherits from and uses the template property to render content that is shown while the component initializes your application.

example.para: The code sample below shows the basic structure for how you build your application pages using the component.
example.code:
Here you will write your application.

The user has been properly authenticated as @ctx.AuthResult.IdTokenClaims["name"]

 Seems that you did not load the app inside of Teams. Loading...

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Components.TeamsApplication.RequireAuthentication
member.summary: Set to true to have the component take care of authenticating the user.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Components.TeamsApplication.ApplicationTemplate
member.summary: The main template for your application.
member.remarks: This template is rendered when the application has been properly initialized by this component.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Components.TeamsApplication.HostNotAvailableTemplate
member.summary: A template that you can use to provide alternative content in cases when the Teams host is not available.
member.remarks: This template is typically rendered when the application is not loaded by Teams.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Components.TeamsApplication.LoadingTemplate
member.summary: The template that is displayed while loading the application.
member.remarks: Nothing is rendered while loading if this template is not defined.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Components.TeamsApplication.ApplicationContext
member.summary: The application context.
member.remarks: This context is provided as the context to the template.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Components.TeamsApplication.ShowApplicationTemplate
member.summary: Determines whether to show the template.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Components.TeamsApplication.ShowHostNotAvailableTemplate
member.summary: Determines whether to show the template.

member.name: M:Blazorade.Teams.Components.TeamsApplication.OnAfterRenderAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls the rendering of the component.

member.name: M:Blazorade.Teams.Components.TeamsApplication.InitializeAsync
member.summary: Handles the main initialization of the component.
member.remarks: This should not be called if the Teams host context is not available.

member.name: T:Blazorade.Teams.Configuration.AzureAdApplicationOptions
member.summary: Options for configuring your application for authentication.

member.name: M:Blazorade.Teams.Configuration.AzureAdApplicationOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Configuration.AzureAdApplicationOptions.ClientId
member.summary: The application (client) ID of your Azure AD application.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Configuration.AzureAdApplicationOptions.TenantId
member.summary: The tenant ID or tenant name ({tenant}.onmicrosoft.com) of the tenant your application specified in is registered in.

member.name: M:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.AuthenticationModule.GetAuthenticationResultAsync(Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context)
member.summary: Uses MSAL.js to authenticate the user specified in and returns the result of that authentication.
member.param: The Teams context to use when resolving the token.
member.remarks: The method attempts to perform the authentication silently, but will fall back to using a popup dialog if the authentication did not succeed.

member.name: T:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.BlazoradeTeamsInteropModule
member.summary: The root module for facilitating communications with the Teams JavaScript SDK.

member.name: M:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.BlazoradeTeamsInteropModule.#ctor(Blazorade.Teams.Configuration.AzureAdApplicationOptions,Microsoft.JSInterop.IJSRuntime,Blazorade.Teams.Interop.ApplicationInitializationModule,Blazorade.Teams.Interop.SettingsModule,Blazorade.Teams.Interop.AuthenticationModule)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the module class.
member.remarks: This class should not be initialized in code. It will be created automatically through Dependency Injection and provided through the property.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.BlazoradeTeamsInteropModule.Authentication
member.summary: Returns a module that is used for authentication.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.BlazoradeTeamsInteropModule.AppInitialization
member.summary: A module that represents the appInitialization module in the Teams SDK.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.BlazoradeTeamsInteropModule.Settings
member.summary: A module that represents the settings module in the Teams SDK.

member.name: M:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.BlazoradeTeamsInteropModule.GetContextAsync
member.summary: Returns the context information loaded from Teams.
member.remarks: This method is called for you when you use the component.

member.name: M:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.BlazoradeTeamsInteropModule.InitializeAsync
member.summary: Initializes your application with Teams.
member.remarks: This method is invoked for you when you use the component.

member.name: M:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.BlazoradeTeamsInteropModule.IsTeamsHostAvailableAsync
member.summary: Determines whether the application has been loaded inside of Teams.

remarks.para: If this method returns false, all the other methods on this module an its child modules will also very likely fail.
You don't have to worry about this when using the component as the root component on your pages, and putting your application content in the template.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.AppIconPosition
member.summary: Personal app icon y coordinate position.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.AppSessionId
member.summary: Unique ID for the current session for use in correlating telemetry data.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.ChannelId
member.summary: The Microsoft Teams ID for the channel with which the content is associated.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.ChannelName
member.summary: The name for the channel with which the content is associated.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.ChannelRelativeUrl
member.summary: The relative path to the SharePoint folder associated with the channel.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.ChannelType
member.summary: The type of the channel with which the content is associated.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.ChatId
member.summary: The Microsoft Teams ID for the chat with which the content is associated.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.DefaultOneNoteSectionId
member.summary: The OneNote section ID that is linked to the channel.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.EntityId
member.summary: The developer-defined unique ID for the entity this content points to.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.FrameContext
member.summary: The context where tab url is loaded (content, task, setting, remove, sidePanel).

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.GroupId
member.summary: The Office 365 group ID for the team with which the content is associated. This field is available only when the identity permission is requested in the manifest.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.HostClientType
member.summary: The type of the host client. Possible values are : android, ios, web, desktop, rigel.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.IsCallingAllowed
member.summary: Represents whether calling is allowed for the current logged in User.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.IsFullScreen
member.summary: Indication whether the tab is in full-screen mode.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.IsMultiWindow
member.summary: Indication whether the tab is in a pop out window.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.IsPSTNCallingAllowed
member.summary: Represents whether PSTN calling is allowed for the current logged in User.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.IsTeamArchived
member.summary: Indicates whether team is archived. Apps should use this as a signal to prevent any changes to content associated with archived teams.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.Locale
member.summary: The current locale that the user has configured for the app formatted as languageId-countryId (for example, en-us).

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.LoginHint
member.summary: A value suitable for use as a login_hint when authenticating with Azure AD. Because a malicious party can run your content in a browser, this value should be used only as a hint as to who the user is and never as proof of identity. This field is available only when the identity permission is requested in the manifest.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.MeetingId
member.summary: Meeting Id used by tab when running in meeting context.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.OSLocaleInfo
member.summary: More detailed locale info from the user's OS if available. Can be used together with the @microsoft/globe NPM package to ensure your app respects the user's OS date and time format configuration.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.ParentMessageId
member.summary: The ID of the parent message from which this task module was launched. This is only available in task modules launched from bot cards.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.RingId
member.summary: Current ring ID.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.SessionId
member.summary: Unique ID for the current Teams session for use in correlating telemetry data.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.SharePoint
member.summary: SharePoint context. This is only available when hosted in SharePoint.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.SubEntityId
member.summary: The developer-defined unique ID for the sub-entity this content points to. This field should be used to restore to a specific state within an entity, such as scrolling to or activating a specific piece of content.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.TeamId
member.summary: The Microsoft Teams ID for the team with which the content is associated.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.TeamName
member.summary: The name for the team with which the content is associated.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.TeamSiteDomain
member.summary: The domain of the root SharePoint site associated with the team.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.TeamSitePath
member.summary: The relative path to the SharePoint site associated with the team.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.TeamSiteUrl
member.summary: The root SharePoint site associated with the team.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.TeamType
member.summary: The type of the team.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.TenantSKU
member.summary: The type of license for the current users tenant.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.Theme
member.summary: The current UI theme.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.Tid
member.summary: The Azure AD tenant ID of the current user. Because a malicious party can run your content in a browser, this value should be used only as a hint as to who the user is and never as proof of identity. This field is available only when the identity permission is requested in the manifest.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.UserLicenseType
member.summary: The license type for the current user.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.UserObjectId
member.summary: The Azure AD object id of the current user. Because a malicious party run your content in a browser, this value should be used only as a hint as to who the user is and never as proof of identity. This field is available only when the identity permission is requested in the manifest.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.UserPrincipalName
member.summary: The UPN of the current user. This may be an externally-authenticated UPN (e.g., guest users). Because a malicious party run your content in a browser, this value should be used only as a hint as to who the user is and never as proof of identity. This field is available only when the identity permission is requested in the manifest.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Context.UserTeamRole
member.summary: The user's role in the team. Because a malicious party can run your content in a browser, this value should be used only as a hint as to the user's role, and never as proof of her role.

member.name: T:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Settings
member.summary: Settings for configuring tab applications with.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Settings.ContentUrl
member.summary: Sets the URL to use for the content of this instance.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Settings.EntityId
member.summary: The developer-defined unique ID for the entity to which this content points.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Settings.RemoveUrl
member.summary: Sets the URL for the removal configuration experience.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Settings.SuggestedDisplayName
member.summary: A suggested display name for the new content. In the settings for an existing instance being updated, this call has no effect.

member.name: P:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.Settings.WebsiteUrl
member.summary: Sets the URL to use for the external link to view the underlying resource in a browser.

member.name: T:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.SettingsModule
member.summary: Represents the settings module in the Teams SDK.

remarks.para: This class must not be created by application in code. It will be provided through the context property.

member.name: M:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.SettingsModule.#ctor(Blazorade.Teams.Configuration.AzureAdApplicationOptions,Microsoft.JSInterop.IJSRuntime)
member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.name: M:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.SettingsModule.GetSettingsAsync
member.summary: Gets the settings for the current instance.
Registers a handler that Teams will call when the user clicks the Save button on the tab configuration dialog.
member.param: The settings to save when the handler is called.

param.name: savingCallback
param.para: A callback that will be called before saving the settings with Teams.

This allows you to perform tasks while the settings dialog is showing before the settings are saved with Teams and the dialog is closed. This is useful if you for instance want to perform some tasks to initialize your tab application.

member.param: The data that will be passed to the .
The callback that will be called when the settings have been successfully saved.
The callback that will be called when there was an error saving the settings.

member.name: M:Blazorade.Teams.Interop.SettingsModule.SetValidityStateAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the validity state for the settings. The initial value is false, so the user cannot save the settings until this is called with true.
member.param: Set to true if settings are valid and saving them is allowed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.BlazoradeTeamsServiceCollectionExtensionMethods
member.summary: Extension methods for working with Dependency Injection in Blazorade Teams.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.BlazoradeTeamsServiceCollectionExtensionMethods.AddBlazoradeTeams(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection)
member.summary: Adds the necessary services required by Blazorade Teams.
member.remarks: If you require that your application users are properly authenticated, then you need to use the other overloaded methods to specify the needed information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.BlazoradeTeamsServiceCollectionExtensionMethods.AddBlazoradeTeams(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Action{Blazorade.Teams.Configuration.AzureAdApplicationOptions})
member.summary: Adds services needed by Blazorade Teams and allows you to specify the application configuration required in order to perform user authentication.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.BlazoradeTeamsServiceCollectionExtensionMethods.AddBlazoradeTeams(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Action{System.IServiceProvider,Blazorade.Teams.Configuration.AzureAdApplicationOptions})
member.summary: Adds services need by Blazorade Teams and allows you to configure the Azure AD application associated with your application using other services configured in the application.
